page.title: 18CHALFONT AREA COMMONLAND
page.content: { Gold Hill Common} - The Jolly Farmer is the only Public House on Gold Hill. It has a beautiful view over the valley in which lies the village of {Chalfont St Peter}.It used to be a small inn until about 50 years ago when it was demolished and enlarged. Gold Hill Baptist Church was built over a century ago. Originally there was an old Chapel which was built in 1790 and was eventually demolished in 1870. The white house that was near the pond has also been demolished to make way for an old peoples home. It was named Hibberts Lodge. The pond has been filled in. The other old cottages are still there. Near the bottom of Gold Hill is a{Coronation Clock}, which was designed by Robert Brown in his {smithy} in Joiners Lane. The slope on Gold Hill Common is very popular for sledging in the Winter.
